The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and its flowers are small, clustered, and often green or red in color. Acalypha supera is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to partial shade. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.

It is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in lowland areas with high humidity. It is also present in parts of northern Australia and some regions of the Pacific Islands. Acalypha supera is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage.
